author: Fredaholic
title: The 3rd clown of the gang
review:
I went to the lego store to get some series 18 packets (for at that time it was the only place to get them)and found the party clown along the way.And for the 3rd clown in the line,it is pretty good!

  When series 1 came out,we were introduced to the original circus clown,horn in hand and colorful,with the great red puffy hair and such.Series 5 brought us the small clown with a short hat and pie.We had the sad clown in series 10 and one licensed clown.Now in 2018 we get the 3rd clown of the gang,party clown.

   His double colored hat is alright and I appreciate that they put the flower on the lower side to cover his odd black eyebrows.His face is funny and entertaining with a neck bow tie peice.The bow tie sometimes does not fit to the clown when it is the wrong side.

   With his new balloon molds in hand,this guy is awesome.His great green pants with even some printing,despite not necessary,and the great,long orange vest flapping about.Some purple is shown and his white gloves really add the touch.Overall,this minifigure is really well detailed and entertaining!

    Feeling:Oh how easy it was.Just feel for the round hat,very easy.Then find the hat's bottem overhang and your done!

author: Odeinoichus
title: We Need More Balloon Animals
review:
Set #71021 Party Clown: Finally getting back to reviewing Series 18, this particular Minifigure features two brand new pieces, a pair of balloon animals and a long tail cloth element for a Minifigure's coat. At least I believe that cloth element was introduced here first, it's been a while and I'm not 100% sure, but I do know this was my first time with it so if originated on Joker first in the DC line I do apologise for having my facts wrong.

The Party Clown features minimal printing on the legs for his pants, a single sided torso print with orange and purple striped vest a large top hat with a printed flower on one side and a different shade of blueish green on the other, a bow-tie element in red, a goofy printed facial expression with his tongue sticking out and two balloon dogs. One in green and one in pink as his accessories.

Overall I did enjoy this Minifigure when I first got him and feel that he works well for any display, Party themed or Carnival/Circus Themed. I love the introduction of the Balloon Animal pieces, but I feel LEGO hasn't done much with them or even introduced any new animals in that form since, other commonly seen animals as Balloons include Giraffes, Elephants, Snakes and I seem to recall an incident with a balloon shaped mouse once, though I could be misremembering. I'd love to see LEGO tackle other balloon animals with other types of clowns in future.

I would strongly recommend this Minifigure mostly for the parts, he's a great addition to any collection or display using the Carnival/Circus/Amusement Park Attraction models that have been used in recent years. Highly Recommended.
